segments.text: What a gross mess in this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water overflowing from the sink, drenching the cabinets—disgusting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's just standing there, one foot in the filthy puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her towel's probably soaked now too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids, sneaking cookies like greedy little pests.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's balancing like a fool on that rickety stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's hand out, begging for her share; it's pathetic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor's slippery with all that water; someone will fall and make it worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden looks clean and nice, not like this slop inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand the waste of it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Turn off the water before it floods more!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open cabinets with dust and all—gross.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Poor oblivious woman; her kitchen's turning into a swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR
